koohiiStory2: These days the biggest concern in airline safety is ICE on the WINGS of the plane. Birds that fly long distances also have to worry about getting ICE on their FEATHERS.

WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: All these feathers. You're a bird man / woman, and you're getting ready to fly. Just as you're about to take off, someone dumps you with honey „ÅØ„Å≠ and you're all goopy, unable to go anywhere.

humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze, bamboo and silk characters, and small seals resemble the shape of two bird feathers. The original meaning is bird feathers. "Said the text": "feather, bird feather hairy also pictographic Where are all from the plume..." " Feather " words per feather draw only three paintings, like three hairs, are three to representatives of the majority, and " they "(Like a " hand " shape) It has three forks to resemble the five fingers of a hand. Zhang Shunhui's "Commentary Notes on Shuowen Jiezi": "The elephant bird has long hair, and the small seal buckles its body and still retains its three paintings. There are still many columns in hand, but the meaning is slightly less than three."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning, "Shangbo Bamboo Book IV. "The Repertoire of Collecting Wind" Jane 4: "The white feather of the bird (heron)", which means that the feathers of the heron are white. "Shangbo Bamboo Book Eight. "Lou (Èπ†) Li (È∑Ö) feather", refers to the feathers of the Èπ†È∑Ö. "Èπ†È∑Ö" is the name of the bird, or "Èπ† Li", "Xuan Li", "Liu Li", it is an alias for " Owl " (owl). It looks good when he is young, but grows ugly and eats his own mother. Called "Unfilial Bird". "poetry. Bei Feng. "Yangqiu" Mao Heng's biography: "Displacement, little is ugly." Kong Yingdashu: "Lu Jiyun: "Displacement, owlet also. From the west of Guan, it is said that owlet is displacement. His son is suitable to grow up, but also eats his mother. Therefore Zhang Huanyun's Èπ†È∑Ö"Eat mother", Xu Shenyun's "Xiao, unfilial bird" is also."" "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "The Way of the Officials" Jan. 26 3: "Money Feather", "Money" may refer to the tail of a leopard, " Feather " refers to the long feathers of a bird, usually refers to the long feathers of a peacock, and " Yan " refers to the tail of an ox. The leopard's tail, the peacock's long feathers, and the bull's tail were all used to decorate carts and horses in ancient times.

Han silk book refers to wings, "Mawangdui Han silk book. Old book lost after the first volume of Lao Zi. Lines 185-186 of the "Five Elements": ""Yingying (Swallows and Swallows) Yu Fei (Flying), Chasing Qi Yu. His son is at home, Yuan (Yuan) is sent to the wild. Looking forward to Fuji, Ji (weeping) boiling (sniveling) Like rain." Nengchai Qiyuran [houneng] to Yuan (yuan)." Here is a quote from "Poetry. Bei Feng. "Swallows" means "Swallows flying together, their wings are staggered. Now you are going to marry another country, I will send you to the countryside from a distance, and when I can't see you, my tears are like rain. Falling down." Wings can cross each other (describe the appearance of harmony and communion) in order to reach the distance.

It is called " feather " on birds, " hair " on beasts, " scales " on dragons and snakes, "Zhou Li": "naked, feathered, and scaled", Zheng Xuan's note: "naked, said Tigers, leopards, braids, and chicks are the genus of beasts with shallow hairs; feathers, bird genus; scales, genus dragons and snakes. " Nude " means short-haired beasts. "Han Fei. "Jie Lao": "People have no hair, and they don't suffer from cold if they don't wear clothes." It means that people don't have animal hair and bird feathers, so they can't overcome the cold without clothes (Zhang Jue).

Bronze inscriptions are used as names, and Yu Ge, son of King Xu: "Yu Yuan, son of Wang (Xu) King, uses Ge", meaning a Ge dedicated to King Xu‚Äôs son Yu. Guojun Xu has a son named " Yu ", Zhang Yu. "Spring and Autumn. Thirty Years of Zhaogong": "Wu Miexu, Xu Zizhangyu went to Chu."

The idiom "Lufan Lun Scarf" means holding a feather fan and wearing a blue ribbon headscarf, describing a calm attitude. Su Shi, "Nian Nujiao": "Looking back at Gong Jin back then, Xiao Qiao married for the first time, with a majestic appearance. A feather fan and a scarf, chatting and laughing, the captive was wiped out." Zhou Yu described Zhou Yu as a vigorous young man, calmly repelling a violent enemy. The metaphor of "wings have become" has a right-hand man, and the power has been consolidated. "Historical Records. Staying in the Marquis Family": "The four of them are assisted by them, and the wings are complete."

" Yu " is extended to the fifth tone of the pentatonic scale, which is the "Yu" of "Gong Shang Jiao Zheng Yu ". Because the fifth tone is the highest of the five, the tone is high and stretched, like spreading wings and flying high. Duan Yucai's "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "Extension is the five-tone feather, "Jin Shu. Le Zhi" says: "Yu, Shu Ye. Yang Qi will recover, all things will breed and thrive."" Chu series of bronze inscriptions with a plus from the " in " sound " ¶è¥ " to represent the name of temperament " feather ", found in Marquis Yi of Zeng bells.

" Yu " is a relatively rare surname, distributed in Xinhui in Guangdong, Hejiang in Sichuan, Taiyuan, Yangquan, Shuozhou in Shanxi, Pingyi in Shandong and other places. According to legend, it is the descendant of Zheng Guoziyu in the Spring and Autumn Period. Chi. "Clan Profile" Zheng Qiao notes: "Ji surname, after Zheng Ziyu." Song Dynasty Deng Mingshi "Ancient and Modern Surname Book Dialectics": "Yu, from the surname Ji, son of Zheng Mu Gong, the word Ziyu, his grandson Jie, is the horse teacher, Take the word "Wangfu" as the clan."

Basic explanation of words
feather
y«î
Bird's hair: feathers. Down. Yu Shu. Yuyi. Lupin. Feather (referring to birds). Feather flag. Yu Miao (Yu Shu).
The wings of fish or insects, in Taoist legends, refer to the flying fairy: feather wings. Yuhan (wings). Yu Shi (a. Flying fairy; b. Taoist).
The feathers on the arrows, by means of arrows: feather hunting.
One of the ancient five tones, equivalent to the numbered musical notation "6".

["Guangyun" Wang Juqie, Shangyu, Yun. ]
["Guangyun" Wang Yuqie, Quyu, Yun. ]
(1) Bird hair. Especially the long hair of a bird.
(2) Five-color feathers. It is mostly used to decorate wooden stands for musical instruments.
(3) The wings of birds or insects.
(4) The code name for birds.
(5) Feathers on ancient arrow shafts. Also refers to arrows.
(6) Ancient dance equipment made of pheasant feathers, held by literary dancers.
(7) Refers to banners.
(8) Yu and complementary wings.
(9) Refers to the fan.
(10) The float on the fishing rod.
(11) Refers to letters.
(12) Party and friends.
(13) One of the five tones.
(14) The name of the mountain.
(15) Ancient unit of measurement.
(16) Link "Yu". House.
(17) Last name. The Spring and Autumn Period Zheng Guoyu Yujie. See "Zuo Zhuan¬∑Xianggong Thirty Years".
